intro: Ruellia imbricata, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering period occurs primarily in the spring and summer. Ruellia imbricata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
